content.description: Start out on Lazy cowgirl, but cut left towards a big hold shortly after leaving the ground.  From a horizontal weakness, bust out a sequence of big moves on bad holds with worse feet.  A tenuous clip, then a few easier-but not easy-moves on slopers will take you to the top.
content.protection: 4-5 draws plus two for the chains.

content.description: Follow the short bolt line up the left side of the wall.  Long enough to count as a climb, but probably not long enough to bother climbing.
content.protection: 2 draws for the climb, 2 more for the anchor.
content.location: On the left side of the north face of the cowboy boulder.

content.description: This short route is just right of the unique double arête feature that looks like a triangle.  The holds are great and climbing is easy.
content.location: This is on the North side of the Cowboy boulder, just right of the obvious double arête that forms a smooth triangle on the face of the boulder.

content.description: This is a unique route that starts on the left arête of a double arête feature.  The route moves right just below the right leaning arête and until you hit the crux which is pulling to the outside of the right arête.  From there it is 5.6 climbing to the chains.
content.protection: 4 bolts plus a bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: The route is located on the obvious double arête feature that forms a triangle on the North side of the Cowboy Boulder.

content.description: Pull hard on some small crimps right off the ground.  Make a long reach, then gain a stance atop the horizontal.  The climbing from this point on is much easier than it looks.
content.location: Smack in the middle of the north face of the Cowboy Boulder

content.description: This is a freestanding boulder just South of the Small Wall Boulder and has a number of short routes on it of varying difficulty levels
